question: I want to spend more time around people with different identities than me.
I have a lot of exposure to people with different identities than me.
If I believe something strongly, I have a hard time changing my opinion.
I sometimes say potentially offensive things.
I feel comfortable sharing space with people who have very different morals than me.
I would like to interact more with people who express controversial views or have different morals than me.
When I'm looking for new information about a subject, I will seek out sources that agree with what I already know.
It doesn't bother me when strangers debate my views, even heatedly.
I enjoy/appreciate humor that others might find offensive.
I would be comfortable with spending time with someone who uses offensive humor.
If I feel strongly about something, I tend to enter conversations with the intention of convincing others to change their minds.
I often say 'always,' 'never,' 'every,' 'all,' 'none,' and other firm, certain words when I'm sharing opinions or information.
My instinct is to defend my opinions or knowledge when someone suggests I might be wrong.
I sometimes knowingly exaggerate things.
My close community consists of people from many racial, cultural, financial, political, and social backgrounds.
I would like my close community to be more diverse.
I would like my close community to include a wide range of beliefs and opinions.
Sometimes I feel stressed about coming up with new things to do with friends.
I prefer doing similar activities rather than trying new ones.
I like having friends who encourage me to try new things.
I want to have more friends with different hobbies and interests.
I feel comfortable around people who are interested in different things than me.
I have a lot of interests, hobbies, and/or passions.
I lose interest in activities easily.
I'd like to practice being interested in things for a longer period of time.
If I don't like something/am not good at something at first, I'm not very good at giving it another chance.
It's easy for me to make and keep friends.
I want to make more friends.
I know what it's like to have a close group of friends who feel like family.
My relationships are the most portant part of my life.
I like to have a very large community.
I feel like I am capable of navigating my emotions, generally speaking.
Loving myself more is a priority for me.
I clearly understand my values.
I have a very strong moral compass, and ethics are important to me.
It's important for me to understand how other people think and feel, and why.
I understand what my emotions feel like in my body.
I know the names of many different emotions.
When I have intense emotions, I am capable of calming myself down before reacting impulsively.
I am able to move on from challenging emotions without my life being halted or consumed.
I would be excited to learn more tools and skills for managing my emotions.
I validate that others' experiences and feelings are real, even if I don't understand them.
I find it easy to talk about things that are distressing or potentially shameful for me.
I consider emotional intelligence to be very important, and I prioritize it.
I enjoy being around emotionally expressive people.
I grew up in an environment where showing emotions was encouraged.
It's easy for me to tell people I love them.
It's easy for me to cry in front of others.
There are many people in my life who I have been vulnerable with.
It is usually easy for me to understand how other people are feeling.
I rarely cut off relationships without communication or warning.
